discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I remember reading something that points to C.

questions.question_text: How should you generate a custom admin role?

choices.D: Add user to admin role OU
choices.B: Add user to security admin group
choices.A: Create admin role and assign privileges
choices.C: Set privileges on the user directly

choices.D: Deploy the legacy client in a virtualization solution, and use that to stream the application to the ChromeOS devices.
choices.C: Go to the Google Play Store and deploy the Android client of the app in question.
choices.B: Write a tutorial on how to install each of the applications using the Linux terminal, and ask users to follow those instructions when first using their new device.
choices.A: Check to see if there’s a web application equivalent that provides all the necessary features, and if so, deploy the URL through the Admin console.

Part of the migration process involves setting up the existing suite of business applications for use with ChromeOS, leveraging cloud technologies whenever possible. questions.question_text: Which management policy is missing within ChromeOS Flex vs ChromeOS?

choices.A: Use shortest possible names for OUs to avoid confusion.
choices.D: Recreate the same OU structure as the current LDAP implementation.
choices.B: Combine Devices and Users into single OUs to avoid operational overhead.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Not super confident, but I’ll go with D.

questions.question_text: A customer is setting up a new Google tenant. You have been tasked with creating the organization unit structure for the Google Admin console. Following Google best practices, how should you set up the new organization units?
You have Long-term Support enabled for all devices within a particular OU. How often will these devices receive a feature update?

discussion.content:
